Textbox.P: J. Vigil -Lead-IMCS Financial Project Manager Support/FTE Management:

LI.LBody: •Completed the February Billing Detail Report reconciliations and compiled Government comments for the ISS, Comm, TIPS, PAO, and Task Order CLINs
•Completed the IMCS Operations Budget PPBE18 submits and requirements gathering for CMO and CCP
•Performed in-depth analysis with the ISS NASA Technical lead in order to refine the ISS Software EAC for CMO
•Performed detailed review of February actuals for all CLINs, updated financial tracking sheets accordingly, and assisted GG with forecasting next month’s cost accruals
•Prepared and released the February Monthly Financial Review Status Reports for all customers reflecting their Current Month, YTD, and EAC projections for all “baseline” content on IMCS
•Led ongoing internal IMCS Training sessions for new IT-A employee
•Provided support to PX in regards to the PAO CLIN financial tracking, monthly activity reports, and PPBE submits
•Coordinated requirements from the customer and IMCS and generated necessary cost estimates for OA-6 and CRS-8 launch support.
•Ongoing IMCS FFP Financial Management: approvals, funding, invoice reconciliation, tracking, actions, budget status reports
•Ongoing T/T Budget Management
•Ongoing Lead support to new IT-A employees
•Ongoing FTE Management

Textbox.P: J. Vigil -Lead-IMCS Contract Surveillance, FTE Management

LI.LBody: •Assisted with the implementation of Task Order, Comm, ISS/Software, and TIPS orders serving as the primary liaison for the IT Business Office to OP, the COR, customers, IMCS Work Control, and the IMCS Business Office

•Created and released the February Comm Catalog Order Reports to all customers; Coordinated cost analysis for SI in regards to Space Florida cost actuals and funding needed for commercial customers; Assisted with the documentation of the TIPS, ISS, and COMM Custom Quotes Order Process Desk Guide
•Provided Business Office feedback and support in generating the ISS Software Maximo Workflow through various meetings
•Led a CMO Core DPS Work Order meeting to review support charged to CMO that should have been supplemental catalog purchases

•Continued to assist in the management of CDR and travel approvals/submittals
•Addressed new requests and revised the IT Budget plan accordingly.
•FTE Coordinated approvals for various backfills with CMO
•Researched SEB charging and supported necessary actions.

Textbox.P: M. Krysta-IMCS Financial Project Manager Support/FTE Management:

LI.LBody: •POC responsibilities have been transitioned to others for FTE and Task Order Management (CLIN 31 & CLIN 32).
•Review of the February Task Order Billing Detail Report reconciliations and compilation/resolution of any comments.

•Prepared Monthly FTE variance explanations to GSDO.

•IMCS Surveillance: for a portion of March, Training/observation on the implementation of Comm with the intent to serve as the backup liaison for the IT Business Office to OP, the COR, customers, IMCS Work Control, and the IMCS Business Office; Training for Comm Service Catalog orders (specifically launch support for upcoming launch), familiarization with the equipment and how each type of equipment or support is priced/billed. Assisted with some of the Comm Service Catalog order approvals and requested funding as needed.
•Review/comment on Exploration Research & Technology Programs (UB) FTE Plan vs Actuals report for month ending Jan 2016.

Successfully transferred duties to other Business Office POC’s.
•ITS3plan updated inventory to be verified, then uploaded into ITSC; will also begin working open actions to determine proper paths forward.
•Begin providing plan writing assistance for the RISCS tool; information sync scheduled for first week of April.
•Continuing to work with Dawn Meyer on the remediation tool as time permits.
•Assigned as backup support for Wanda’s AirWatch duties; converted my former account to match Wanda’s so that we can work together on troubleshooting more complex issues as they arise.
•Began research work on the remediation tracking pilot, working with Glenn Seaton to get up to speed. Will assist Dawn Meyer in exploring future uses for the tool.

•Reviewed and consolidated the data resulting from KATS 10201 for the CDM Implementation Data Call. The data collected is for all IT systems and devices and will be used to ensure the correct amount of licenses and hardware are sufficient for the CDM implementation.
•Continue working on Information Technology Security Support Services (ITS3) security plan with Bryan Boatright. Set to complete close out POA&M to update the plan to REV 4 compliant by April 1st.
•Attend the DHS Readiness event for CDM.
•Attend the CDM SCR/SRR review.

•Continue to communicate with Jason Bollinger and Dave Campbell to become more familiar with “behind the scenes” details of the CDM and RISCS projects to better provide Henry Yu with accurate project updates and progress.

•Completed security control implementation review for Launch Services Program Information System, which is a massive security plan with 10 subsystems, where I documented more than 500 security findings
•Completed security control implementation reviews for Kennedy Public Affairs IT, Operational Support Devices, and Universal Propellant Servicing System
•Supported Ongoing Authorization Briefings for SCCS Ops, SCCS Dev, and Service Now
•Leveraged a Department of Defense Authorization to Operate for ProjNet to gain authorization for usage at KSC (ProjNet is an externally hosted system being used by NE)
•Assessed Version 3.0 of the RFI form deployed this month; identified a few bugs to be worked out.
•Supported Ann Marie Keim and Dawn Ramirez in reviewing POA&M closure requests from various systems
•Expanding participation in the Ongoing Authorization reviews/briefings.
•Create security plan and risk assessment for Newforma on behalf of NE (waiting for people outside of NASA to provide information when they have no incentive to do so)

•Data verification of Security Plans
•Information Technology Security Center

•Processing RFIs

•Continue management of Project Hardware, Software Infrastructure, and System Monitoring.
•Continue supporting RISCS deployment.
•Continue with managing the KDC Move.
•On going privacy review and assessment of IT assets, and analysis of compliance trends
•Installed numerous server assets in the new KSC data center for ASUS\ITSEC-EDW project.
•KDC move in progress, 20-something major tasks in progress.
•Finalized RISCS environmental configuration.
•Worked on getting SCAP scores higher for our security plan to close an open POAM.
•Worked with KACE support to clean up the KACE database for the main KSC KACE server to ensure that backups complete faster allowing users to use the KACE server earlier.

Textbox.P: Worked on script that was released to Agency to pull local account information on Windows for CDM OCIO data call.Script was able to gather information on over 20,000 machines within a short period of time.Seaton -Sys Admin/KACE

•Problem occurred when the scale of model prefabs in the EXO-Sim unity projects were edited without communicating to creator, causing customer complaints. Resolved through team communications regarding the importance of maintaining baseline.
•Supported the BASALT (Biologic Analog Science Associated with Lava Terrains) project remote meetings. Our team is developing plans and hardware for field exercises in late FY16.
•Test flights of upgraded Honeywell T-Hawks were successful. The upgrades allow the systems to operate on alternate legal frequencies. Hardware has been upgraded and most has been returned to KSC.

•RFA (Radio Frequency Authorization) has been acquired for the unlicensed (2.4GHz) and C-Band frequencies for the Honeywell T-Hawks. I coordinated with KSC frequency spectrum manager (Steve Schindler, former; Ashley Stockbridge, current) to obtain authorization to operate the T-Hawks.

•Supported the EFT-1 L/R meetings and teleconferences. Decisions are being made for a go forward path leading up to EM-1. We are developing new instrumentation hardware for ship and test article integration during recovery tests and missions.
•Worked to develop a support plan for the upcoming NASA KSC Swarmathon challenge at the KSCVC. Our team is providing hardware and technical support to the project.

LI.LBody: •Continue to fine tune Total Cost Ownership Model (J. Cardamone)
•Issue Center Action for Inventory Update for Q2 FY2016 Reporting Period submission, analyze the data and upload to the OMB portal.
•Provided feedback to the Data Center Optimization Memorandum

•Completed on-site visit the week of 3/7/2016 to review Computational Research Facility design, participate in reviews of collected IT data, participate in PUE analysis, modeling and discussions, and to meet with key stakeholders.

•For GSFC core data center, continued to slowly collect bits and pieces of data from GSFC. Completed formulating baseline power assessment and PUE report for the GSFC Building 28 N174 data center.Baseline PUE has been established. Center complete.
•For ARC HEC data center, reviewed documentation and analyzed data to determine feasibility of estimating PUE for short term.

•For HQ core data center, received required drawings from HQ POC. Reviewed documentation and analyzed data to determine if sufficient information is available to estimate a PUE for short term. Requested and received some additional information from HQ POC to better scope this effort.

•Annotated next to the recent list of responses from TCCO/RTKL on issues regarding PUE, IT load, and CFD analysis; reviewed with LaRC POC. Continue to provide support to LaRC with respect to the construction of their new data center.

•Received ATO for procurement of PTS. Planned travel to HQ and ARC for on-site data center assessment has been delayed per the direction of the NASA Customer until Q3 2016. Milestone planned date updated to reflect this change.
•Going forward, per FITARA, baseline PUE will be calculated for all non-core data centers as well. PUE modeling tool will be utilized for this calculation in place of on-site visits.
•Complete baseline power assessment and PUE report for the ARC & HQ data centers
•Issue Center Action to collect data and calculate PUE for Q2 FY2016 Reporting Period submission
•Begin effort to establish PUE baseline for non-core data centers.

•Submitted DNS request to point to new production Presto server.
•Java fix (1.8.0_71-b15) installed in test, stage and production Presto environments.

•Issue Center Action for status on Data Center closures for Q2 FY2016 Reporting Period submission.
•Continue to provided project management functions
•Completed and submitted the spreadsheets associated with STRAW KATS action for NASA Annual Capital Investment Review (ACIR) –Application Portfolio Assessment Data Call.

•Reviewed SSPP Executive Brief to validate and submit the correct totals for data centers that will remain open end of FY15, FY16 and FY18.

•Continue to support the IT-C3 move to the SSPF.
•Facilitated the IDAMS CCB and Project Status meeting.
•Updated PIV card to Four Cert PIV Card.
•Facilitate the IDAMS and Presto production server move from CIF to new KDC.
•Continue to provide Project Management functions related to the ADCC project.
•Supported meetings to build two prototypes for retaining OIS-M headsets in FR1 to address safety concerns
•Submitted works orders to IMCS to connect the MOSB to the SSPF cellular distribution system
•Supported discussions with Frequentis on OIS-M Type B water intrusion problem
•Submitted ROM to the CRCV for relocating 17 OIS-M keysets from IOZ at the O&C to Plum Brook Ohio
•Completed draft revision of Circuit Information Management System (CIMS) Validation document, IM-COM-I-0506. Document is currently out two week review process. Hope to release by Mid-April.

•Successfully prepared and presented the OTN2 Operational Readiness Review (ORR) to the Architectural Control Board (ACB) on 03/31. Received board approval to place the new Carrier Ethernet based backbone into service. This completes a three year development cycle for this project.
•Provided technical evaluations of several Kennedy Data Center cable installations in support migration from the CIF data center to the new KDC.
•Continue support to the Voice and Imagery Branch.
•Continue support to the Networks and Data Branch.
•Continued work on the cellular distributed antenna system SOW for central campus.
•Coordinating SOW and Basis of Estimate for MPPF Phase II Implementation.This will finish the installation of communications equipment and services in the MPPF in support of Orion servicing.
•Continue support to the Networks and Data Branch.

•K7-1557 (MARGO) Demolition –oversaw IMCS contractor pre-cable work prior to upcoming scheduled service outage in early April to activate the new communications hut (K6-1607A) and clear/abandon connectivity with K7-1557 so the demolition contractor can begin his work.

•VAB –Walked down the VAB 3C1 area with IMCS contractor to determine what communications cabling and hardware could be removed by the demolition contractor without disrupting service in the surrounding area.

•Banana River Repeater –walked down KSC/CCAFS manhole pathway implementation to help determine the solution for getting under the small foot bridge and the impact it will have to the installation of the fiber cabling and inner duct/researched the AIP fiber cable FM/FS 04 that is buried along Ransom Rd. for possible use at the new proposed FPL substation site.

•OCP -found discrepancies in the OCP drawings that required IMCS to dispatch technicians to verify Fiber Optic Terminal (FOT) 06B at the State Road 3 Water Pump Station to correct/modify the FOT drawings.

•Delaware North -investigate all circuits with CIMS database to determine if CMO is properly identified as the correct funding source for service in the proximity of Delaware North facilities and assessed if these were correctly identified.
•Multi-user Facilities -Investigated a list of server facilities identified as Multi-User Facilities to determine which locations would need Single-Mode fiber cable upgrades.

•CIMS -Investigated a possible problem reported by IMCS Cable Field System Specialist about a glitch in the program. Investigation revealed that the program is functional as designed and the FSS will need to correct/update missing data whenever they come across it. The “Unknown” data is coming from the Cable Information section and it is a result of outdoor Telephone Terminal Cabinets (TTC) not being in a facility or room.
•Working with ML on cost impact for a dual stacked POCS II camera housing in order to meet requirements.
•Working on procuring IP equipment in order to stand up a 10 channel BCDS IP distribution test system over KNET.
•Support of Commercial Crew Imaging designs.
•Submitted work orders for the final disposition of the remaining five analog BCDS channels.The current plan is to either terminate or convert these channels to digital by 4/8/16.

•On 3/23/16 the Technical Coordination Meeting (TCM) for Space Launch System was held to discuss comments from Change Request (CR) SLS-00417-X.If recommendations are approved and funded POCS will add four additional high-speed cameras to the system.Also worked out new locations for assets due to platforms that were removed from the Mobile Launcher (ML) design.
•Conducted testing on four different vendor-provided video encoders and decoder for image quality, latency, and interoperability of equipment.

•Test results showed that VITEC portable decoders and encoders are best solution for most applications at KSC; the Elemental Live equipment had some unique features, making it a prime candidate for NASA TV applications.
•Additional testing is ongoing as requested by the NASA video group.
•Continue support to the Networks and Data Branch.
•Continue support.
•Refresh –managing the upcoming 2804/2805 changes to seat offerings
•SN -Assist the customer with training Org Rep’s in Service Now

•IT-D is working on the development of a testing plan for the T1 OIS-M Interface.

•IT-D Engineering is working with Frequentis to establish why the Type B (Class I Div II) keysets are leaking. Currently the RTV that seals the display is suspect. Engineering has emphasized the importance that the units be rated as Class I Div II due to the use during hazardous operations.
